arguments.template:
<ng-container *ngIf="orientation==='bottom' || orientation==='right'">
          <section class="sme-layout-relative sme-position-flex-auto">
              <ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="content"></ng-container>
          </section>
          <section class="sme-layout-relative sme-position-flex-none sme-border-color-base-80" [class.sme-border-left-sm]="orientation === 'right'"
              [class.sme-border-top-sm]="orientation === 'bottom'">
              <ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="pane"></ng-container>
          </section>
      </ng-container>
      <ng-container *ngIf="orientation==='top' || orientation==='left'">
          <section class="sme-layout-relative sme-position-flex-none sme-border-color-base-80" [class.sme-border-right-sm]="orientation === 'left'"
              [class.sme-border-bottom-sm]="orientation === 'top'">
              <ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="pane"></ng-container>
          </section>
          <section class="sme-layout-relative sme-position-flex-auto">
              <ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="content"></ng-container>
          </section>
      </ng-container>
      <ng-template #content><ng-content select="sme-split-view-content"></ng-content></ng-template>
      <ng-template #pane><ng-content select="sme-split-view-pane"></ng-content></ng-template>
      <!-- The reason to use ng-tempalte to wrap the ng-content element instead of directly to use ng-content in both two ng-containers above is:
      If we use ng-content elements directly in both 2 ng-containers, there will be 2 ng-content elements with the same selector. But Angular will only 
      resolve the first ng-content in multiple ng-content elements with same selector even the first one is in a ngIf false block.
      So when the orientation is "top" or "left", no ng-content element will be resolved then nothing would render.
      In order to solve this problem, we have to use ng-template to wrap the ng-content to make sure one selector maps to one ng-content.
      Then we use ng-container and ngTemplateOutlet to call the ng-template. 
      Thx for reading till here...... -->

<ng-container *ngIf="orientation==='bottom' || orientation==='right'">
          <section class="sme-layout-relative sme-position-flex-auto">
              <ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="content"></ng-container>
          </section>
          <section class="sme-layout-relative sme-position-flex-none sme-border-color-base-80" [class.sme-border-left-sm]="orientation === 'right'"
              [class.sme-border-top-sm]="orientation === 'bottom'">
              <ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="pane"></ng-container>
          </section>
      </ng-container>
      <ng-container *ngIf="orientation==='top' || orientation==='left'">
          <section class="sme-layout-relative sme-position-flex-none sme-border-color-base-80" [class.sme-border-right-sm]="orientation === 'left'"
              [class.sme-border-bottom-sm]="orientation === 'top'">
              <ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="pane"></ng-container>
          </section>
          <section class="sme-layout-relative sme-position-flex-auto">
              <ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="content"></ng-container>
          </section>
      </ng-container>
      <ng-template #content><ng-content select="sme-split-view-content"></ng-content></ng-template>
      <ng-template #pane><ng-content select="sme-split-view-pane"></ng-content></ng-template>
      <!-- The reason to use ng-tempalte to wrap the ng-content element instead of directly to use ng-content in both two ng-containers above is:
      If we use ng-content elements directly in both 2 ng-containers, there will be 2 ng-content elements with the same selector. But Angular will only 
      resolve the first ng-content in multiple ng-content elements with same selector even the first one is in a ngIf false block.
      So when the orientation is "top" or "left", no ng-content element will be resolved then nothing would render.
      In order to solve this problem, we have to use ng-template to wrap the ng-content to make sure one selector maps to one ng-content.
      Then we use ng-container and ngTemplateOutlet to call the ng-template. 
      Thx for reading till here...... -->
